episode.description: Yang Liping is a popular Chinese dancer and choreographer. Her "Peacock Dance," based on the folk dances of her hometown in Yunnan Province, has been highly praised all over the world.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Harvard psychologist Mahzarin Banaji devised a test to measure our hidden biases towards others, according to race, gender, or social class. She discusses the origins of bias and its cost to society.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Lee So-hyun, the founder of a company supporting people with autism, looks forward to a time when autistic individuals are accepted, feel comfortable, and can fully play their part in society.
episode.description: Lee So-hyun, the founder of a company supporting people with autism, looks forward to a time when individuals with autism are accepted, feel comfortable, and can fully play their part in society.
episode.subtitle: Co-Existing With Autism in Society: Lee So-hyun / Founder of Autistar
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Jon Jandai is a Thai organic farmer whose self-reliant way of living attracts people from around the world. He simplifies life with the question: "Life is easy, why make it difficult?"
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Andria Zafirakou, an art teacher in London, won the Global Teacher Prize 2018 and is using the prize money of $1 million to create a foundation to help provide arts to disadvantaged school children.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Kiko Matthews broke a world record when she rowed solo and unsupported across the Atlantic. It was just 6 months after having brain surgery for a rare illness. She raised thousands of pounds for the hospital that had saved her life.
episode.description: Kiko Matthews from UK broke a world record when she rowed solo across the Atlantic, just 6 months after having brain surgery. She raised thousands of pounds for the hospital that had saved her life.
episode.subtitle: Breaking a World Record: Kiko Matthews / World Record Ocean Rower
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Acclaimed Japan-China expert and Harvard Professor Emeritus Ezra Vogel discusses the history, cultural connection, and relationship between the 2 nations, and suggests how they can forge closer ties.
episode.description: Acclaimed Japan-China expert and Harvard Professor Emeritus Ezra Vogel discussed the history, cultural connection and relationship between the 2 nations, and suggested how they can forge closer ties.
episode.subtitle: Japan-China Relations, an Outsider's Perspective: Ezra Vogel / Sociologist
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: By examining a company's environmental, social, and governance when analyzing potential stocks, financial advisor Lauren Compere is helping investors make socially responsible investing decisions.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Chinese lawyer Tang Shuai uses sign language to protect the legal rights of his clients who have hearing difficulties. He hopes for a law-abiding society that is more considerate to their needs.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Since founding The Voice of Libyan Women in 2011, doctor and women's rights advocate Alaa Murabit has challenged the global status quo with initiatives to put women in positions of leadership.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Professor at Harvard Graduate School of Education Todd Rose demystifies the century-old average-based systems in society and proposes design paradigms to embrace individuality and unique talents.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Madeline Stuart is a fashion model and entrepreneur with Down syndrome, traveling around the world with the support of her mother Rosanne. She breaks from conventional ways to open people's minds.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: We speak with the director of "Proyecto Hombre" - an NGO providing addiction treatment, mainly for drugs, to 17,000 people per year in Spain - on the true causes and solutions for this modern disease.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: A young engineer tackling the serious issue of landmine clearance in Cambodia has developed an unattended robot to replace dangerous manual demining.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: In China, most visually impaired people become masseuses or masseurs, but the blind Dong Lina became a verbal artist. She presents her thoughts on the determination needed to overcome many obstacles.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Hiroto Kawasaki moved to China at age 66 and succeeded in organic farming using cattle dung. Supported by young Chinese, he is working to change local customs long dependent on chemical fertilizer.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Trinh Khanh Ha works on developing robotic prosthetic arms in Vietnam. With groundbreaking prosthetic arms, she gives hope to disabled people who gave up their work.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Delia Ferreira Rubio represents an international NGO that aims to eliminate crimes such as bribery and embezzlement worldwide. How can we prevent corruption, which she says undermines our daily lives?
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Kees Veldboer, the Ambulance Wish Foundation founder, has fulfilled over 13,000 final wishes of terminally ill patients. He reveals his thoughts about his contacts with dying people.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Robert Riener founded the Cybathlon, a global contest spurring the development of robotic assistive devices for people with disabilities. What role can robotics play in creating a diverse society?
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Since 2014, the conflict in eastern Ukraine has left many soldiers MIA. Yaroslav Zhilkin, the founder of Black Tulip, tells us why he collects bodies in the troubled area.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Bart Roetert, co-founder of Instock, a restaurant in the Netherlands, has rescued 800,000 kilograms of food waste. He tells how to address food waste issues in an efficient and positive manner.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: NORA is the lead vocalist of Orquesta de la Luz, a world-famous salsa band from Japan. She speaks about her passion for music, and what she hopes to accomplish through her work with the group.
episode.description: NORA is the lead vocalist of Orquesta de la Luz, a world-famous salsa band from Japan. She speaks about her passion for music, and what she hopes to accomplish through her work with the group.
episode.subtitle: No Salsa, No Life: NORA / Singer
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Open source technology advocate, Wikimedia Foundation CEO Katherine Maher encourages everyone to contribute and share knowledge and information on the free online encyclopedia, Wikipedia.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Sho Kitagawa plays the balalaika, a traditional Russian stringed musical instrument. He was the first person from outside Russia to win a prestigious Russian music competition.
episode.description: Sho Kitagawa plays the balalaika, a traditional Russian stringed musical instrument. He was the first person from outside Russia to win a prestigious Russian music competition.
episode.subtitle: A Three Generation Dream: Sho Kitagawa / Balalaika Player
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Noriaki Imai returned to Japan after a hostage ordeal in Iraq only to face harsh criticism, which made him a social recluse. Today, he supports young people who have similarly withdrawn from society.
episode.description: Noriaki Imai returned to Japan after a hostage ordeal in Iraq only to face harsh criticism, which made him a social recluse. Today, he supports young people who have similarly withdrawn from society.
episode.subtitle: Giving Young People Hope: Noriaki Imai / President, DxP
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Famous for its "Freak Cabaret" performances, the Ukrainian music and theater band Dakh Daughters sings about the harsh situation in Ukraine. Its vocalist explains the thoughts behind the lyrics.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Mitsuhiro Takasaki, President of Engineer Inc., developed innovative heavy-duty pliers that can remove stripped or rusted screws with ease. What is his manufacturing philosophy and business strategy?
episode.description: Mitsuhiro Takasaki, President of Engineer Inc., developed innovative heavy-duty pliers that can remove stripped or rusted screws with ease. What is his manufacturing philosophy and business strategy?
episode.subtitle: Removing Troublesome Screws: Mitsuhiro Takasaki / President, Engineer Inc.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: The key to helping Syrian refugees is to enable refugee widows to earn their own living and raise their children. Jihan Kaisi, the executive director of an NGO, is generating employment for them.
episode.description: The key to helping Syrian refugees is to enable refugee widows to earn their own living and raise their children. Jihan Kaisi, the executive director of an NGO, is generating employment for them.
episode.subtitle: Employment Lifeline for Syrian Refugee Women: Jihan Kaisi / Executive Director, URDA
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Katsuobushi is a traditional Japanese foodstuff. It is dried bonito, typically shaved into umami-rich flakes. Mai Nagamatsu is the owner of a restaurant that specializes in recipes using katsuobushi.
episode.description: Katsuobushi is a traditional Japanese foodstuff. It is dried bonito, typically shaved into umami-rich flakes. Mai Nagamatsu is the owner of a restaurant that specializes in recipes using katsuobushi.
episode.subtitle: You Can't Beat Katsuobushi: Mai Nagamatsu / Owner, Katsuo Shokudo
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Tomosuke Noda is the principal of the River School, a camp designed to teach kids how much fun rivers can be. He talks about the many outdoor activities the kids enjoy and his vision for the program.
episode.description: Tomosuke Noda is the principal of the River School, a camp designed to teach kids how much fun rivers can be. He talks about the many outdoor activities the kids enjoy and his vision for the program.
episode.subtitle: Raising River Kids: Tomosuke Noda / Nonfiction Writer & Canoeist
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Yoshihiko Akimoto developed canned bread that can be stockpiled for as long as 3 years. It is used as an emergency food and distributed as relief supplies to areas suffering from food shortages.
episode.description: Yoshihiko Akimoto developed canned bread that can be stockpiled for as long as 3 years. It is used as an emergency food and distributed as relief supplies to areas suffering from food shortages.
episode.subtitle: The Potential of Canned Bread: Yoshihiko Akimoto / President & CEO, Pan Akimoto
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Ziauddin Yousafzai is a teacher and activist who stood up to the Taliban in Pakistan. With his daughter Malala, he campaigns for girl's education and equality around the world.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Air pollution is causing health problems in Ulaanbaatar, the Mongolian capital. We speak with former Mongolian Minister of the Environment, Oyun Sanjaasuren, on its causes and solutions.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Jokha Alharthi, the first Man Booker International Prize winner writing in Arabic, is also the first female Omani novelist translated into English. What message does her work have for today's world?
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: The Kobe Shu-Shin-Kan Breweries have been producing sake for over 260 years. We speak with president Takenosuke Yasufuku about how his firm makes sake with huge appeal both in Japan and worldwide.
episode.description: The Kobe Shu-Shin-Kan Breweries have been producing sake for over 260 years. We speak with president Takenosuke Yasufuku about how his firm makes sake with huge appeal both in Japan and worldwide.
episode.subtitle: Sake Goes Global: Takenosuke Yasufuku / President, Kobe Shu-Shin-Kan Breweries
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Tomohiko Izutsu was on a path to work in space science research, but he changed course, and is now dedicated to revitalizing rural communities through space-themed events. What drives his mission?
episode.description: Tomohiko Izutsu was on a path to work in space science research, but he changed course, and is now dedicated to revitalizing rural communities through space-themed events. What drives his mission?
episode.subtitle: Space-Themed Community Revitalization: Tomohiko Izutsu / Community Revitalization Specialist
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Apichatpong Weerasethakul directed "Uncle Boonmee Who Can Recall His Past Lives," winning at Cannes in 2010. He connects memories of oneself with society and politics, and is now focusing on Colombia.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: In 2019, Sueko Nakamura directed a documentary about young women in Japan who've been in trouble with the law. She herself had a troubled adolescence that included time in a juvenile detention center.
episode.description: In 2019, Sueko Nakamura directed a documentary about young women in Japan who've been in trouble with the law. She herself had a troubled adolescence that included time in a juvenile detention center.
episode.subtitle: People Change, So Can Society: Sueko Nakamura / Co-founder, Second Chance!
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Shin-ai-Juku is a Japanese NPO that's been providing support for foreigners living in Japan for over 40 years. Chief Director Mariko Takekawa talks about what's happening on the ground.
episode.description: Shin-ai-Juku is a Japanese NPO that has been providing support for foreigners living in Japan for over 40 years. Chief Director Mariko Takekawa talks about what's happening on the ground.
episode.subtitle: Supporting Foreign Residents: Mariko Takekawa / Chief Director, Consultation Education For Foreign Residents "Shin-ai-Juku"
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Kenichi Noguchi is a farmer who grows lotus plants. His lotus roots sell for $50 each, and are served in fancy restaurants the world over. We ask Noguchi what makes his lotus root so amazing.
episode.description: Kenichi Noguchi is a farmer who grows lotus plants. His lotus roots sell for $50 each, and are served in fancy restaurants the world over. We ask Noguchi what makes his lotus root so amazing.
episode.subtitle: Luxury Lotus Root: Kenichi Noguchi / Lotus Root Farmer
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Ryusen Hamono has developed a steak knife with excellent sharpness that has been carefully designed to be safe to use. President Koji Masutani talks about the work that went into crafting the blade.
episode.description: Ryusen Hamono has developed a steak knife with excellent sharpness that has been carefully designed to be safe to use. President Koji Masutani talks about the work that went into crafting the blade.
episode.subtitle: A Cutting-Edge Steak Knife: Koji Masutani / President, Ryusen Hamono
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Pianist Gohei Nishikawa was diagnosed with focal dystonia as an adult. Unable to use 3 fingers on his left hand, he performs using his other 7. How did he find his way back to the piano?
episode.description: Pianist Gohei Nishikawa was diagnosed with focal dystonia as an adult. Unable to use 3 fingers on his left hand, he performs using his other 7. How did he find his way back to the piano?
episode.subtitle: The Sound of Resilience: Gohei Nishikawa / Pianist
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Chi-chi Nwanoku is a world-famous double bassist and is founder of the Chineke! Orchestra, the first classical orchestra in Europe to be made up of majority black and minority ethnic musicians.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: For years, Keiko Itabashi has hosted a radio show about disaster preparedness in Miyagi Prefecture, an area that suffered grave damage in Japan's 3.11 disaster. What lessons does she have for her audience?
episode.description: For years, Keiko Itabashi has hosted a radio show about disaster preparedness in Miyagi, an area that suffered grave damage in Japan's 3.11 disaster. What lessons does she have for her audience?
episode.subtitle: Survival Cooking Consciousness: Keiko Itabashi / Radio Personality
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Hiroki Iwasa grows high-end strawberries in Miyagi Prefecture -- a region that was hit hard by the 2011 Tohoku earthquake and tsunami. How is he revitalizing the local economy and agricultural industry?
episode.description: Hiroki Iwasa grows high-end strawberries in Miyagi Prefecture-a region that was hit hard by the 2011 Tohoku earthquake and tsunami. How is he revitalizing the local economy and agricultural industry?
episode.subtitle: High-tech Strawberry Farming: Hiroki Iwasa / President & CEO, GRA
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: We talk with photographer Lekima Hung about his history and passion capturing and exhibiting photographs of marine plastic waste pollution in Vietnam to raise awareness about the issue.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Renowned choreographer Twyla Tharp discusses her new book, which delves into her philosophy of aging and highlights the importance of moving our bodies to maximize our potential, whatever our age.
episode.description: Renowned choreographer Twyla Tharp discusses her new book, which delves into her philosophy of aging and highlights the importance of moving our bodies to maximize our potential, whatever our age.
episode.subtitle: A New Approach to Aging: Twyla Tharp / Choreographer and Author
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: The seas of Fukushima Prefecture were gravely harmed by the 2011 nuclear disaster and its aftermath. For the past 9 years, Riken Komatsu has worked tirelessly to restore them and related industries.
episode.description: The seas of Fukushima were gravely harmed by the 2011 nuclear disaster and its aftermath. For the past 9 years, Riken Komatsu has worked tirelessly to restore them and related industries.
episode.subtitle: Saving the Fukushima Seas: Riken Komatsu / Local Activist
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Nihon Homespun blends silk, cotton, synthetic fibers and traditional washi paper into their sought-after wool fabrics. President Kanji Kikuchi talks about the homespun textile tradition.
episode.description: Nihon Homespun blends silk, cotton, synthetic fibers and traditional washi paper into their sought-after wool fabrics. President Kanji Kikuchi talks about the homespun textile tradition.
episode.subtitle: Limitless Fabrics: Kanji Kikuchi / President, Nihon Homespun
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Yoshihiko Ishikawa has ascended to the elite ranks of the world's ultramarathon runners. He tells us how he got involved in this intense sport, and how he managed to rise to the top.
episode.description: Yoshihiko Ishikawa has ascended to the elite ranks of the world's ultramarathon runners. He tells us how he got involved in this intense sport, and how he managed to rise to the top.
episode.subtitle: Unlocking Your True Potential: Yoshihiko Ishikawa / Ultramarathon Runner
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Myanmar in southeast Asia suffers from a lack of safe drinking water. Hisafumi Shogi works with locals to develop the water supply infrastructure. He talks about the road so far, and what lies ahead.
episode.description: Myanmar in southeast Asia suffers from a lack of safe drinking water. Hisafumi Shogi works with locals to develop the water supply infrastructure. He talks about the road so far and what lies ahead.
episode.subtitle: Water for Life: Hisafumi Shogi / Waterworks Engineer
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Koichiro Kobayashi has won gold at the Paraclimbing World Championships 4 times in a row. He works to help people who are visually impaired take up climbing. What does the sport mean to him?
episode.description: Koichiro Kobayashi has won gold at the Paraclimbing World Championships four times in a row. He works to help people who are visually impaired take up climbing. What does the sport mean to him?
episode.subtitle: Climbing for Diversity: Koichiro Kobayashi / Blind Free Climber
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: A young Rwandan female entrepreneur has had success producing and marketing beetroot wine and providing stable employment for local women. The program follows her battle to succeed in business.
episode.description: A young Rwandan female entrepreneur has had success producing and marketing beetroot wine and providing stable employment for local women. The program follows her battle to succeed in business.
episode.subtitle: Turning Beetroot Into Wine: Assumpta Uwamariya / CEO, Karisimbi Wines Limited
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Houriya Taheri, the Middle East's first FIFA A-licensed women's soccer coach, speaks on what women athletes in the region, whose participation has been limited, need to help them spread their wings.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Albert Lin is an award-winning explorer and scientist from California who is innovating technology to uncover hidden stories of history from lost civilizations and ancient ruins all over the world.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Terumo is a Japanese manufacturer of medical devices such as catheter-based solutions for the treatment of coronary arteries. Company CEO Sato Shinjiro talks about reducing the burden on patients.
episode.description: Terumo is a Japanese manufacturer of medical devices such as catheter-based solutions for the treatment of coronary arteries. Company CEO Sato Shinjiro talks about reducing the burden on patients.
episode.subtitle: Putting Patients First: Sato Shinjiro / President & CEO, Terumo
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Popular among the Berliners, "Kreuzberger Himmel" serves dishes from Syria and Afghanistan. Tolke opened this restaurant to provide occupations for refugees. We asked his principle in helping them.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Takeuchi Masahiko runs and funds a nonprofit that builds schools for the blind around the world. Takeuchi himself is visually impaired. We speak with him about his life's work.
episode.description: Takeuchi Masahiko runs and funds a nonprofit that builds schools for the blind around the world. Takeuchi himself is visually impaired. We speak with him about his life's work.
episode.subtitle: Hope for the Blind: Takeuchi Masahiko / Nonprofit Director
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Bartender Gokan Shingo was named 2017 International Bartender of the Year. He talks about the secrets behind his signature cocktails and what he loves about bar culture.
episode.description: Bartender Gokan Shingo was named 2017 International Bartender of the Year. He talks about the secrets behind his signature cocktails and what he loves about bar culture.
episode.subtitle: The Great Cocktail Quest: Gokan Shingo / Bartender
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: For many foreigners living in Japan, the language barrier is hard to overcome. Choi Sungja is an advisor at a cafe where foreigners become chefs, communicating with Japan through their native cuisine.
episode.description: For many foreigners living in Japan, the language barrier is hard to overcome. Choi Sungja is an advisor at a cafe where foreigners become chefs, communicating with Japan through their native cuisine.
episode.subtitle: Culture Comms: Choi Sungja / Advisor, Comm Cafe
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Director Iwaisawa Kenji won the top prize at the Ottawa International Animation Festival for his 2019 feature film. He talks about his hand-drawn approach and what he hopes to convey through his work.
episode.description: Director Iwaisawa Kenji won the top prize at the Ottawa International Animation Festival for his 2019 feature film. He talks about his hand-drawn approach and what he hopes to convey through his work.
episode.subtitle: The Future of Animation: Iwaisawa Kenji / Film Director
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: The unique Green School in Indonesia founded by John Hardy and his wife Cynthia aims for a sustainable future. Favoring a progressive education, children and parents gather from all over the world.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Yoshitake Shinsuke is one of Japan's best known children's book authors, the winner of multiple international prizes. He finds inspiration in aspects of kids' lives that grown-ups tend to ignore.
episode.description: Yoshitake Shinsuke is one of Japan's best known children's book authors, the winner of multiple international prizes. He finds inspiration in aspects of kids' lives that grown-ups tend to ignore.
episode.subtitle: Inspiration from Everyday Life: Yoshitake Shinsuke / Children's Book Author
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Ceramic artist Kuwata Takuro is known for using experimental procedures to produce startling, one-of-a-kind work. He has exhibited all over the world. He talks about his creative process.
episode.description: Ceramic Artist Kuwata Takuro is known for using experimental procedures to produce startling, one-of-a-kind work. He has exhibited all over the world. He talks about his creative process.
episode.subtitle: Ceramic Marvels: Kuwata Takuro / Ceramic Artist
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Hagiuda Megumi imports and sells African roses from Kenya as part of an effort to contribute to women's employment in the region. She talks about what roses mean to her, and what drives her.
episode.description: Hagiuda Megumi imports and sells African roses from Kenya as part of an effort to contribute to women's employment in the region. She talks about what roses mean to her, and what drives her.
episode.subtitle: Roses That Empower: Hagiuda Megumi / Founder & CEO, Afrika Rose
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Bernd Gaiser, a co-founder of Berlin CSD, talks about why he encourages coming out of the closet and how he came to set up a multi-generational housing project for those of any sexual orientation.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Extreme weather around the world is causing an increase in major natural disasters. We ask Ishii Mieko, a nurse who has worked in several disaster zones, about how to save lives.
episode.description: Extreme weather around the world is causing an increase in major natural disasters. We ask Ishii Mieko, a nurse who has worked in several disaster zones, about how to save lives.
episode.subtitle: Preventing Disaster-related Deaths: Ishii Mieko / Professor, International University of Health and Welfare Graduate School
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Richard H. Kaszynski formed a global network to rapidly conduct clinical drug trials in order to fight against infectious disease pandemics. He talks about a promising drug candidate for COVID-19.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: When the Covid-19 pandemic hit Malaysia, Rashvin Singh and his team at his social enterprise wanted to make a difference and began producing face shields to help frontliners.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Minister Audrey Tang's IT measures against COVID-19 greatly contributed to Taiwan's successful containment of the virus. She is also a leading force behind Taiwan's digital democracy.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Health psychologist, Professor Susan Michie is advising the British government on how to help people change their behavior in a pandemic so as to control the spread of coronavirus.
episode.description: Health psychologist, Professor Susan Michie is advising the British Government on how to help people change their behavior in a pandemic so as to control the spread of coronavirus.
episode.subtitle: Changing Behavior in a Pandemic: Susan Michie / Professor of Health Psychology
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Japanese violinist Lena Yokoyama performed on the rooftop of Cremona's hospital, as a tribute to healthcare workers and patients struggling through the coronavirus emergency.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Fashion designer Morinaga Kunihiko creates technologically innovative styles that no one has ever seen before. He tells us what motivates his work, and discusses the untapped potential of clothing.
episode.description: Fashion designer Morinaga Kunihiko creates technologically innovative styles that no one has ever seen before. He tells us what motivates his work, and discusses the untapped potential of clothing.
episode.subtitle: Trailblazing Fashion Design: Morinaga Kunihiko / Fashion Designer
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Social entrepreneur Nakamoto Chizu started up a brand that makes colorful bags out of African fabrics. She talks about her vision of providing stable employment to Uganda's single mothers.
episode.description: Social entrepreneur Nakamoto Chizu started up a brand that makes colorful bags out of African fabrics. She talks about her vision of providing stable employment to Uganda's single mothers.
episode.subtitle: Empowering Ugandan Women: Nakamoto Chizu / Social Entrepreneur
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: As the coronavirus strikes the world, South Korea's corona prevention measures are recognized as a success. Professor Moran Ki, the chief of COVID-19 task force is leading the success with government.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Taavi Kotka of Estonia, an IT powerhouse with 99% of its government services available online, speaks on how engineering will shape our technological future.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Khaled Reshad's day job is running a local medical clinic in Japan, but he also works to build hospitals and schools in his home country of Afghanistan. We speak with Dr. Reshad about his work.
episode.description: Khaled Reshad's day job is running a local medical clinic in Japan, but he also works to build hospitals and schools in his home country of Afghanistan. We speak with Dr. Reshad about his work.
episode.subtitle: Healing with Healthcare and Education: Khaled Reshad / Physician, Reshad Clinic/Executive Director, Karez Health & Educational Services
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Yamami Koji creates award - winning kaleidoscopes that rise to the level of art. What sort of wizardry goes into crafting optical instruments that surprise and delight the eyes?
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Yamasaki Nobuyoshi's company produces items like food trays and garbage bags using a sustainable limestone-based material. He talks about its potential as an alternative to paper or plastic.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Pastor Okuda Tomoshi has been working with homeless people for over 30 years, helping 3,500 get back on their feet. He talks about what is necessary to create a society where no one is left ignored.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Ishii Katsuyuki heads a manufacturer of custom sports wheelchairs used by top athletes competing in the Paralympic Games. He talks about design, craftsmanship, and the secret to the company's success.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Illustrations by Estonian artist Eiko Ojala have appeared in newspapers and magazines worldwide. His gorgeous paper-like graphic designs shine a penetrating light on modern society.
episode.description: Illustrations by Estonian artist Eiko Ojala have appeared in newspapers and magazines worldwide. His gorgeous paper-like graphic designs shine a penetrating light on modern society.
episode.subtitle: Quiet Art Speaks Strongly: Eiko Ojala / Illustrator
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Nakajima Satoshi is a software engineer developing a free app for takeout orders that he designed to help businesses pushed to the verge of bankruptcy by the economic effects of the COVID-19 outbreak.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Nishimoto Yu-ki is an innovative practitioner of sumi-e [ink wash painting]. His art-which has incorporated video, CG and more-is exceptionally dynamic, and he is always pushing himself further.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: For 40 years, Gushiken Takamatsu has been excavating the remains of those who died in the Battle of Okinawa at the end of the Pacific War. He talks about lingering scars and the value of peace.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Buku Jalanan Chow Kit is a school co-founded by Siti Rahayu who aims to provide education for poor and stateless children who live in the red light district of Malaysia.
episode.description: Buku Jalanan Chow Kit is a school co-founded by Siti Rahayu who aims to provide education for poor and stateless children who live in the red light district of Malaysia.
episode.subtitle: Hope Through Education: Siti Rahayu / Co-founder of Buku Jalanan Chow Kit
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Dominique Chen, known for his outstanding research in the field of information studies, talks about ways to achieve well-being through digital communications.
episode.description: Dominique Chen, known for his outstanding research in the field of information studies, talks about ways to achieve well-being through digital communications.
episode.subtitle: Pursuing the Future for Digital Technology and Humans: Dominique Chen / Associate Professor, School of Culture, Media and Society, Waseda University
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Earth Heir, a social enterprise in Malaysia is founded by Sasibai Kimis to empower the lives of marginalized communities, emphasizing on combining traditional craftsmanship with modern design.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: In 2013, Teshima Daisuke developed oral hygiene products that don't harm the body if swallowed. His innovative business model supports people with disabilities. We asked Teshima about his motivation.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Okahara Kosuke is known for award-winning photojournalism documenting the human condition in places like South America, Africa, and China. He reflects on his humanistic approach.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: With amazing economic growth in recent years, Rwanda has been pursuing a progressive ICT policy. The woman appointed Minister of ICT and Innovation at merely 35 talks about the future ICT offers.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Author of How Contagion Works, an essay on the science of infectious disease, physics PhD Paolo Giordano clarifies the issues we face and speaks on how to live in a post-pandemic world.
episode.description: Author of How Contagion Works, an essay on the science of infectious disease, physics PhD Paolo Giordano clarifies the issues we face and speaks on how to live in a post-pandemic world.
episode.subtitle: United for Change: Paolo Giordano / Writer
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Saengduean Chailert, founder of Elephant Nature Park in northern Thailand, has devoted her life to caring for Asian elephants that were wounded while made to work as performance animals or in logging.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Wada Atsushi is an award-winning animator who plays with the concept of "ma," or "the space in between," building tension through contrasting movement and the absence of movement. What inspires him?
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Fukunaga Takeshi's latest film, which is about the indigenous Ainu of Japan, received special jury mention at the 2020 Tribeca Film Festival. What inspires him to tell stories of minority communities?
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Anoushka Shankar is a sitarist, composer and producer who has won many awards in the world music scene. She is the daughter of Indian musician Ravi Shankar. She is also a social activist and feminist.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Robin Hanbury-Tenison is one of the greatest explorers of his era, and has travelled to remote areas of the world, where he has witnessed huge changes to the environment in the last 60 years.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Osawa Shuichi is a baker who won the 2019 Mondial du Pain, arguably the world's most prestigious breadmaking competition. He tells us how he crafts his top-class bread.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Ogawa Yoko's novel "The Memory Police" was shortlisted for the prestigious International Booker Prize in 2020. What are the major themes and motifs that characterize her work?
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Perrine & Charles Herve-Gruyer, Proprietors in France, have quested for tomorrow's agriculture that reconstructs ecosystems, inspired by methods of ancient civilizations and latest scientific studies.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: A former German teacher who created a revolutionary system to provide people in developing countries with one-dollar glasses shares his thoughts on the meaning of sustainable social business.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Larry Littlebird, a Native American Elder/Storyteller, founded Hamaatsa, a place to reconnect with nature with indigenous wisdom, by listening to nature and to each other in this challenging time.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: For three long decades, Vosot Ikeida has been a hikikomori, locking himself in his room and avoiding human contact. Now, he wants to do something about it. His answer? Communication and connection.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Yamada Mio empowers Rwandan women to rise up from poverty. She talks about opening a Japanese restaurant in the Rwandan capital and ongoing efforts to support the women during the COVID-19 pandemic.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Jordi Faulí is the 9th head architect of the Sagrada Familia. He attempts to complete the building by 2026, 100 years after Gaudi's death. We look at the outlook during the COVID-19 pandemic.
episode.description: Jordi Fauli is the 9th head architect of the Sagrada Familia. He attempts to complete the building by 2026, 100 years after Gaudi's death. We look at the outlook during the COVID-19 pandemic.
episode.subtitle: Road to Completion - Sagrada Familia: Jordi Faulí / Head Architect of the Sagrada Familia
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: In Ethiopia, one of the world's poorest countries, Samejima Hiroko founded a company that ethically produces high-quality leather handbags. She tells us the story of her unique products and business.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Akimoto Rina runs an online food market that directly connects farmers and fishers with consumers. She talks about her website and what she's doing to help food producers in the time of COVID-19.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: GiGi's Playhouse supports people with Down Syndrome. 49 are in the U.S. and Mexico. 30,000 people use their program. We speak to founder Nancy Gianni as she continues her mission during COVID-19.
episode.description: GiGi's Playhouse supports people with Down Syndrome. 49 are in the U.S. and Mexico. 30,000 people use their program. We speak to founder Nancy Gianni as she continues here mission during COVID-19.
episode.subtitle: Expanding Support for Down Syndrome: Nancy Gianni / GiGi's Playhouse, Chief Belief Officer and GiGi's Mom
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Torajan woman and leader of the world's largest body representing Indigenous Peoples, Rukka Sombolinggi has long championed indigenous rights in Indonesia with her passionate and fiery oratory skills.
episode.description: Torajan woman and leader of the world's largest body representing Indigenous Peoples, Rukka Sombolinggi has long championed indigenous rights in Indonesia with her passionate and fiery oratory skills.
episode.subtitle: Defender of Indigenous Peoples: Rukka Sombolinggi / Secretary General of AMAN, Indigenous Peoples Alliance of the Archipelago
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Fujiyama Taijyu is a practitioner of tezuma, a uniquely Japanese art of illusion. He placed in the top five at the World Championships of Magic. We ask him about tezuma's enduring appeal.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Hayashi Kaname has built Lovot, a companion robot whose main purpose is to encourage people to love-just by being there. He explains how his pet-like creation can soothe us in these trying times.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Mr. Boyan Slat and his foundation's goal are getting rid of plastic waste from the oceans all over the world. They focus on developing technologies to achieve it. He adds supports from people is key.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Dr. Anthony Back created a medical communication guide called Vital Talk. It helps practitioners better understand the emotions of patients and family, a matter of great importance in the COVID-19 era.
episode.description: Dr.Anthony Back created a medical communication guide called Vital Talk. It helps practitioners better understand the emotions of patients and family, a matter of great importance in the COVID-19 era.
episode.subtitle: Fighting COVID-19 With Medicine and Emotion: Anthony Back / Palliative Care Doctor
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Saraya, a maker of health and hygiene products, has undertaken a massive "handwashing project" in Uganda that has helped to stop the spread of disease. We speak with company president Saraya Yusuke.
episode.description: Saraya, a maker of health and hygiene products, has undertaken a massive "handwashing project" in Uganda that has helped to stop the spread of disease. We speak with company president Saraya Yusuke.
episode.subtitle: Sustainable Sanitation: Saraya Yusuke / President, Saraya
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: In 2020, Hiraide Kazuya received the prestigious Piolet d'Or mountaineering award for the third time-the first such feat by a Japanese climber. What fuels his passion for ascending unclimbed routes?
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Max Richter is one of the most successful composers in the contemporary music world. He has produced critically acclaimed albums of his own compositions, and also writes for films, ballet and opera.
episode.description: Max Richter is one of the most successful composers in the contemporary music world. He has produced critically acclaimed albums of his own compositions, and also writes for films, ballet, and opera.
episode.subtitle: Communicating With Music: Max Richter / Composer
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Endo Ken is developing next-generation artificial limbs, including the world's best sports prosthetic and a robotic leg that reduces strain for those with disabilities. What is his vision for society?
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Director Ladj Ly's film "Les Miserables" was a Jury Prize winner in Cannes Film Festival 2019. He tells us how we can overcome racism and poverty as BLM expands in France.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Emmai Alaquiva discovers BLM also to the deaf and hard of hearing. He shows us this through his 59-second video "Unspeakable." He also talks about discrimination and the challenges ahead.
episode.description: Emmai Alaquiva discovers BLM also to the deaf and hard of hearing. He shows us this through his 59-second video "Unspeakable." He also talks about discrimination and the challenges ahead.
episode.subtitle: Black Lives Matter to the Deaf and Hard of Hearing: Emmai Alaquiva / Film Director, Composer
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Lee Ayu Chuepa, founder of Akha Ama Coffee and a member of Thailand's Akha ethnic minority, provides high-quality coffee to global consumers while protecting the livelihood of his community's farmers.
episode.description: Lee Ayu Chuepa, founder of Akha Ama Coffee and a member of Thailand's Akha ethnic minority, provides high-quality coffee to global consumers while protecting the livelihood of his community's farmers.
episode.subtitle: Enriching People's Lives With Coffee: Lee Ayu Chuepa / Founder of Akha Ama Coffee, Social Entrepreneur
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: HARA is an illusionist who has performed live and on television in over 30 countries, winning numerous awards. We speak with him about how he strives to conjure up "magic that only I can do."
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Graphic designer Shimada Tamotsu was chosen to design the official logo for the 2025 World Exposition to be held in Osaka, Japan. What is the concept behind the eye-catching design?
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Londoner, Josie Naughton co-founded Help Refugees, a charity devoted to raising funds to help refugees and displaced people who are escaping war, persecution and poverty.
episode.description: Londoner, Josie Naughton co-founded Help Refugees, a charity devoted to raising funds to help refugees and displaced people who are escaping war, persecution and poverty.
episode.subtitle: The Forgotten Refugees: Josie Naughton / Co-founder & CEO Help Refugees
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Lilian Thuram, former football star who contributed the victory of France in FIFA World Cup 1998, has fought with his foundation against racism through books, exhibitions and workshops since 2008.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Producer of hit musicals discusses how Broadway theaters should reopen safely and profitably in the COVID-19 era and respond to the Black Lives Matter movement by appealing to a more diverse audience.
episode.description: Producer of hit musicals discusses how Broadway theaters should reopen safely and profitably in the COVID-19 era and respond to the Black Lives Matter movement by appealing to a more diverse audience.
episode.subtitle: Bringing the Lights Back to Broadway: Yasuhiro Kawana / Theater Producer
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Stella Jean has submitted action plans to the council to eliminate discrimination in the Italian fashion industry. In particular, she is struggling to give non-white youth a chance to get jobs.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: The bicycles painstakingly crafted by Konno Shinichi offer superior technology and design. Japanese cyclists love them, and they've won multiple awards at international trade shows.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Purintei Merin performs rakugo, a type of storytelling that has a more than 400-year history. She writes and delivers original pieces in both Japanese and English. Hear her story.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: For former astronaut Chris Hadfield, life in self-isolation amid the pandemic is similar to that of an astronaut in space. He shares his tips on how to survive and thrive in the long-running pandemic.
episode.description: For former astronaut Chris Hadfield, life in self-isolation amid the pandemic is similar to that of an astronaut in space. He shares his tips on how to survive and thrive in the long-running pandemic.
episode.subtitle: Command Your Spaceship in Isolation: Chris Hadfield / Former Astronaut
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: In 2017, Fujiki Daichi became the first Asian countertenor to debut at the Vienna State Opera. What does he wish to convey to audiences through his dazzling performances?
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Sociology professor James Nolan warns of the danger to society of an unchecked technological mindset. His new book explores the complicity of doctors in covering up the dangers of the atom bomb.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Kogenji Ryota is a world champion pole dancer who was named Mr. Pole Dance 2020. How does he come up with his routines, for which audiences have described him as being like a floating white fairy?
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Dr. Claire Wardle is on a mission to help the global public understand the dangers of disinformation and misinformation, which have proliferated with the rise of social media and now the coronavirus.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Executive Producer, Stephen Garrett, has had a 40-year career in the entertainment industry producing films and creating television drama in Hollywood and the UK for a global audience.
episode.description: Executive Producer, Stephen Garrett, has had a 40-year career in the entertainment industry producing films and creating television drama in Hollywood and the UK for a global audience.
episode.subtitle: A New Era of Drama: Stephen Garrett / Drama Producer
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Yukari Suzuki has been working for reconciliation between the Dutch, Japanese and Indonesian. How can people transcend division through dialogue?
episode.description: Yukari Suzuki has been working for reconciliation between the Dutch, Japanese and Indonesian. How can people transcend division through dialogue?
episode.subtitle: Bridging the Division: Yukari Tangena Suzuki / Chairperson "The Foundation Dialogue Netherlands-Japan-Indonesia"
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Nodoka Okisawa is one of the world's most buzzed-about young conductors. In 2019 she won the prestigious International Besancon Competition. We speak to her about her musical passions.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Nishimura Satoshi is developing an original electric car concept, as well as a microscope that can perform high-res imaging of living organisms. He talks about the philosophy of making things.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Rewilding to revive lost species and restore nature. In the United Kingdom, an aristocratic couple's efforts are attracting attention. We talk to Isabella Tree, who is also a writer.
episode.description: Rewilding to revive lost species and restore nature. In the United Kingdom, an aristocratic couple's efforts are attracting attention. We talk to Isabella Tree, who is also a writer.
episode.subtitle: The Rewilding of an Aristocrat's Farm: Isabella Tree / Writer, Environmentalist
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Mounir Biba, multiple world champion of Breaking, runs the project about breaking and coaching to support young people. He contributed also to the promotion of Breaking for Olympic sports inclusion.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Wendy Kopp heads "Teach For All." It recruits recent graduates to teach for a 2-year mission. It operates in 59 countries providing quality education in challenging places and even during COVID-19.
episode.description: Wendy Kopp heads "Teach For All." It recruits recent graduates to teach for a 2-year mission. It operates in 59 countries providing quality education in challenging places and even during COVID-19.
episode.subtitle: Quality Education Around the World: Wendy Kopp / CEO and Co-Founder of Teach For All
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Fashion designer Agnès b, who has long supported artists and continued various social activities, recently opened new art gallery in Paris. She talks about the power of art in society.
episode.description: Fashion designer Agnes b, who has long supported artists and continued various social activities, recently opened new art gallery in Paris. She talks about the power of art in society.
episode.subtitle: Embracing a Passion for Art and Beauty: Agnès b. / Fashion Designer
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: In civil war-torn Uganda, over 30,000 children were abducted and forced to serve as fighters. Follow Ogawa Shingo's quest to reintegrate former child soldiers into society through vocational training.
episode.description: In civil war-torn Uganda, over 30,000 children were abducted and forced to serve as fighters. Follow Ogawa Shingo's quest to reintegrate former child soldiers into society through vocational training.
episode.subtitle: Believing in the Strength of the African People: Ogawa Shingo / Director of NGO Supporting Social Reintegration of Child Soldiers
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Thai restaurant owner/chef Phanuphon Bulsuwan uses a wide array of local ingredients for his dishes. He is also taking steps to combat food waste, both in his own kitchen and society at large.
episode.description: Thai restaurant owner/chef Phanuphon Bulsuwan uses a wide array of local ingredients for his dishes. He is also taking steps to combat food waste, both in his own kitchen and society at large.
episode.subtitle: Delicious Dishes, Zero Waste: Phanuphon Bulsuwan / Owner/Chef, Blackitch Artisan Kitchen
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: For over 50 years, Tamai Yoshiomi has provided educational support to children who have lost one or both parents. His outreach extends to Africa, where he raises leaders out of vulnerable children.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Jimmy Pham's vocational school in Vietnam provides young deprived people with hospitality training. He talks about the struggle for sustenance during the economic downturn caused by COVID-19.
episode.description: Jimmy Pham's vocational school in Vietnam provides young deprived people with hospitality training. He talks about the struggle for sustenance during the economic downturn caused by COVID-19.
episode.subtitle: Have the Courage to Open Up Your Future: Jimmy Pham / Founder of KOTO
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Iida Masashige creates immersive video presentations for dome-shaped projection screens that hang overhead in planetariums and other theaters. He talks about his vision, themes, and methods.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: A Vietnamese Japanese engineer discusses the high-frequency ventilator he developed to save the lives of premature infants, but it has been considered difficult to put into practical use.
episode.description: A Vietnamese Japanese engineer discusses the high-frequency ventilator he developed to save the lives of premature infants, but it has been considered difficult to put into practical use.
episode.subtitle: Technology to Defeat the Coronavirus: Tran Ngoc Phuc / Chairman, Metran
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Mizutani Yoshihiro invented a cardboard bed for use in evacuation centers during natural disasters. He talks about what drives him in his quest to improve conditions at emergency shelters.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Richard Misrach, an eminent photographer who has been shooting deserts in the U.S. for half a century, discusses the split of America as he has been bearing witness it.
episode.description: Richard Misrach, an eminent photographer who has been shooting deserts in the U.S. for half a century, discusses the split of America as he has been bearing witness it.
episode.subtitle: Beyond the Divide: Richard Misrach / Photographer
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Wanda took part in the Warsaw Uprising in 1944, which was the resistance struggle to the Nazi regime. Nowadays, she protests against the politicians about some social matters from her experience of the war.
episode.description: Wanda took part in the Warsaw Uprising in 1944, which was the resistance struggle to Naci regime. Nowadays, she protests against the politicians about some social matters from her experience of war.
episode.subtitle: Uprising for Human Rights: Wanda Traczyk-Stawska / Former Warsaw Uprising Soldier
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Nureehan Da-ouli, a female Muslim conservationist, strives to protect hornbills - the species that play a detrimental role in the survival of the forest and the livelihood of her community.
episode.description: Nureehan Da-ouli, a female Muslim conservationist, strives to protect hornbills - the species that play a detrimental role in the survival of the forest and the livelihood of her community.
episode.subtitle: Protecting Hornbills and Communities: Nureehan Da-ouli / Hornbill Conservationist
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Takahama Kan was awarded one of Japan's most prestigious manga prizes in 2020. She talks about overcoming alcoholism and how the experience ties into her internationally acclaimed work.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Kotchakorn Voraakhom is a Thai landscape architect known for designing public parks that combat flooding. In order to fight an unpredictable future, she uses nature as her blueprint.
episode.description: Kotchakorn Voraakhom is a Thai landscape architect known for designing public parks that combat flooding. In order to fight an unpredictable future, she uses nature as her blueprint.
episode.subtitle: Floating a Sinking City: Kotchakorn Voraakhom / Landscape Architect
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Marc Hull-Jacquin of Shelter Movers has rescued over 2,000 people fleeing domestic violence, providing 6 sanctuaries in Canada since 2016. He's fighting an increase in DV cases during the pandemic.
episode.description: Marc Hull-Jacquin of Shelter Movers has rescued about 2,000 people fleeing domestic violence, providing 6 sanctuaries in Canada since 2016. He's fighting an increase in DV cases during the pandemic.
episode.subtitle: Rescuing People from Domestic Violence: Marc Hull-Jacquin / Founder/Executive Director of Shelter Movers
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Rosemarie Garland-Thomson challenges stereotypes about people with disabilities. An advocate for human diversity, she explores how disabled culture and identity have evolved throughout history.
episode.description: Rosemarie Garland-Thomson challenges stereotypes about people with disabilities. An advocate for human diversity, she explores how disabled culture and identity have evolved throughout history.
episode.subtitle: Human Diversity for a Flourishing Life: Rosemarie Garland-Thomson / Bioethicist
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Since 2010, Gilles Delebarre has engaged himself as the director in "Démos," a music education program for children operated by Philharmonie de Paris for the sake of the unity in a local society.
episode.description: Since 2010, Gilles Delebarre has engaged himself as the director in Demos, a music education program for children operated by Philharmonie de Paris for the sake of the unity in a local society.
episode.subtitle: Music Education for Democracy: Gilles Delebarre / Music Pedagogue, Philharmonie de Paris
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Director Eric Khoo is one of Singapore's leading creators. His recent short film is making waves online. We speak to Eric Khoo, spreading an important message "love and humanity" through film.
episode.description: Director Eric Khoo is one of Singapore's leading creators. His recent short film is making waves online. We speak to Eric Khoo, spreading an important message "love and humanity" through film.
episode.subtitle: Connecting a Divided World Through Film: Eric Khoo / Filmmaker
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Musician and scholar Chi Suwichan Phattanaphraiwan, a member of the Pgaz k'Nyau (Karen) ethnic group in northern Thailand, advocates for ethnic equality and fosters cultural identity through music.
episode.description: Musician and scholar Chi Suwichan Phatthanaphraiwan, a member of the Pgaz k'Nyau (Karen) ethnic group in Northern Thailand, advocates for ethnic equality and fosters cultural identity through music.
episode.subtitle: Ethnic Equality Through Music: Chi Suwichan Phattanaphraiwan / University Professor, Social Artivist
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Akram Khan, the British dancer and choreographer, calls for urgent action to save the performing arts and to support young dancers, in the face of the UK's enforced lockdown.
episode.description: Akram Khan, the British dancer and choreographer, calls for urgent action to save the performing arts and to support young dancers, in the face of the UK's enforced lockdown.
episode.subtitle: Dancing Through a Pandemic: Akram Khan / Dancer and Choreographer
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Filmmaker Mansour documents the impact of wars in the Middle East on the people of Lebanon. When parts of Beirut were destroyed by a massive blast in August 2020 her cameras captured the aftermath.
episode.description: Filmmaker Mansour documents the impact of wars in the Middle East on the people of Lebanon. When parts of Beirut were destroyed by a massive blast in August 2020 her cameras captured the aftermath.
episode.subtitle: Documenting Lebanon's Pain: Carol Mansour / Documentary Filmmaker
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Textile expert Olga Reiche is working with rural artisans to find ways to build a sustainable industry. Overcoming natural disasters and war through textiles, she shares her inspiring story.
episode.description: Textile expert Olga Reiche is working with rural artisans to find ways to build sustainable industry. Overcoming natural disaster and war through textiles, she shares her inspiring story.
episode.subtitle: Textiles Overcoming Crises: Olga Reiche / Guatemalan Textile Expert

episode.content: Paul Miller, aka DJ Spooky: multimedia artist, composer and author. Miller creates music and art inspired by science and nature to motivate people to change the world.

episode.subtitle: Reimagine Hope With Music: Paul Miller aka DJ Spooky / Multimedia Artist, Composer, Author

episode.content: Sarah Al Amiri is both a minister and the science lead of the UAE's Mars probe mission, which successfully entered orbit in 2021. What is it that pushes her and her country towards space exploration?
episode.description: Sarah Al Amiri is both a minister and the science lead of the UAE's Mars probe mission, which successfully entered orbit in 2021. What is it that pushes her and her country towards space exploration?
episode.subtitle: Unlocking UAE's Future With Science: Sarah Al Amiri / Minister of State for Advanced Technology, UAE

episode.content: Wasfi Kani is on a mission to share opera with the world. For the last 3 decades she had taken opera into prisons, and in 2016, she created a new opera house in the UK.
episode.description: Wasfi Kani is on a mission to share opera with the world. For the last three decades she had taken opera into prisons, and in 2016, she created a new opera house in the UK.

episode.content: Columbia University's Christopher Emdin talks about his method of centering culture to engage young people in science and how the pandemic is creating an opportunity to transform education.
episode.description: Columbia University's Christopher Emdin talks about his method of centering culture to engage young people in science and how the pandemic is creating an opportunity to transform education.
episode.subtitle: Reimagining Education: Christopher Emdin / Associate Professor, Columbia University

episode.content: Using 360-degree cameras, a South African virtual reality video creator is helping to preserve wild animals on the verge of extinction by dispatching documentary films.

episode.subtitle: Saving Wild Animals With VR: Ulrico Grech-Cumbo / VR Filmmaker

episode.content: Pianist Alice Sara Ott made her first recording in 3 years, as a reflection on life. Living with multiple sclerosis, she keeps a contemporary performance empowering her audience.
episode.description: Pianist Alice Sara Ott made her first recording in three years, as a reflection on life. Living with multiple sclerosis, she keeps a contemporary performance empowering her audience.
episode.subtitle: Life Is Like Prélude: Alice Sara Ott / Pianist

episode.content: Anand Menon is Professor of European Politics and Foreign Affairs at King's College London. He also directs the UK in a Changing Europe project which studies the effects of Brexit and its implications for the UK.
episode.description: Anand Menon is Professor of European Politics at King's College London. He also directs the UK in a Changing Europe project which studies the effects of Brexit and its implications for the UK.
episode.subtitle: Brexit and Beyond: Anand Menon / Professor of European Politics and Foreign Affairs
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Maye Musk, dietitian, fashion model and mother of Elon, shares the secrets to flourishing in her 70s. Her independent spirit took her from struggling single motherhood to iconic status on billboards.
episode.description: Maye Musk, dietitian, fashion model, and mother of Elon, shares the secrets to flourishing in her 70s. Her independent spirit took her from struggling single motherhood to iconic status on billboards.
episode.subtitle: Flourishing Past Seventy: Maye Musk / Dietitian and Fashion Model
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Tsuda Yuichi leads a project at the Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency that recently completed a mission to return subsurface samples of an asteroid to Earth. He reflects on the scientific milestone.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Pietro Bartolo is a doctor. For 30 years he treated refugees from Africa on the Italian island of Lampedusa. Now, as a Member of the European Parliament, he defends the rights of immigrants.
episode.description: Pietro Bartolo is a doctor. For 30 years he treated refugees from Africa on the Italian island of Lampedusa. Now, as a Member of the European Parliament, he defends the rights of immigrants.
episode.subtitle: Saving Lives in the Mediterranean: Pietro Bartolo / Doctor and MEP
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: As a refugee, Omar Ahmad realized how the media portrayed the refugees differed from reality. Now as a citizen journalist, he hopes to deliver narratives, told from the refugee's perspective.
episode.description: As a refugee, Omar Ahmad realized how the media portrayed the refugees differed from reality. Now as a citizen journalist, he hopes to deliver narratives, told from the refugee's perspective.
episode.subtitle: Sharing Voices from Our Refugee Camp: Omar Ahmad / Citizen Journalist, Campji
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Kagii Yasuaki talks about photographing underwater worlds in oceans across the globe, including his periodic trips to document submarine environments in the disaster-stricken Tohoku region of Japan.
episode.description: Kagii Yasuaki talks about photographing underwater worlds in oceans across the globe, including his periodic trips to document submarine environments in the disaster-stricken Tohoku region of Japan.

episode.content: Chicago-based stand-up comedian Saku Yanagawa talks about deconstructing American society from a uniquely Japanese perspective and honing his own comedic voice.
episode.description: Chicago-based stand-up comedian Saku Yanagawa talks about deconstructing American society from a uniquely Japanese perspective and honing his own comedic voice.
episode.subtitle: The Positive Power of Comedy: Saku Yanagawa / Stand-Up Comedian
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Journalist Maria Ressa is found guilty in a case seen as a test of press freedom. In a country where journalists are under threat, Ressa's case became symbolic and followed internationally.
episode.description: Journalist Maria Ressa is found guilty in a case seen as a test of press freedom. In a country where journalists are under threat, Ressa's case became symbolic and followed internationally.
episode.subtitle: Braving Press Freedom: Maria Ressa / Journalist
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Lual Mayen fled South Sudan and grew up as a refugee. He created a video game on that experience. Players on the 2021 online version will fund refugee camps. He now supports youths to learn IT.
episode.description: Lual Mayen fled South Sudan and grew up as a refugee. He created a video game on that experience. Players on the 2021 online version will fund refugee camps. He now supports youths to learn IT.
episode.subtitle: Reality of Refugees Through Video Games: Lual Mayen / Video Game Developer, Founder of Junub Games
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: British explorer Sir Ranulph Fiennes has spent his life in pursuit of extreme adventure, risked his life in some of the most ambitious expeditions ever undertaken and raised millions for charity.
episode.description: British explorer Sir Ranulph Fiennes has spent his life in pursuit of extreme adventure, risked his life in some of the most ambitious expeditions ever undertaken and raised millions for charity.
episode.subtitle: Never Giving Up: Ranulph Fiennes / Expedition Leader & Author
episode.title: Direct Talk
